intro: Aethionema syriacum, commonly known as Syrian rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and Central Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are oblanceolate to elliptic in shape, with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Aethionema syriacum thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
